Rule.Name: AdvancedNamingRules
Rule.Context: {0} name {1} doesn't conform the specified style: {2}.
Rule.Description: Provides wide and flexible variety of naming rules. See StyleCop+ tab for detailed settings.

Rule.Name: ElementMustNotBeOnSingleLine
Rule.Context: The {0} must not be placed on a single line. The opening and closing curly brackets must each be placed on their own line.
Rule.Description: Extends original SA1502 rule (disable SA1502 when using this rule). See more options clicking StyleCop+ node in the tree.

Rule.Name: OpeningCurlyBracketsMustNotBePrecededByBlankLine
Rule.Context: An opening curly bracket must not be preceded by a blank line.
Rule.Description: Extends original SA1509 rule (disable SA1509 when using this rule). See more options clicking StyleCop+ node in the tree.

Rule.Name: ClosingCurlyBracketMustBeFollowedByBlankLine
Rule.Context: Statements or elements wrapped in curly brackets must be followed by a blank line.
Rule.Description: Extends original SA1513 rule (disable SA1513 when using this rule). See more options clicking StyleCop+ node in the tree.

Rule.Name: ElementsMustBeSeparatedByBlankLine
Rule.Context: Adjacent elements must be separated by a blank line.
Rule.Description: Extends original SA1516 rule (disable SA1516 when using this rule). See more options clicking StyleCop+ node in the tree.

Rule.Name: ConstructorSummaryDocumentationMustBeginWithStandardText
Rule.Context: The documentation text within the constructor's summary tag should be "Initializes a new instance." or should begin with the text: "{0}".
Rule.Description: Extends original SA1642 rule (disable SA1642 when using this rule). Allows any constructor to have the following summary text: "Initializes a new instance.".

Rule.Name: DestructorSummaryDocumentationMustBeginWithStandardText
Rule.Context: The documentation text within the destructor's summary tag should be "Finalizes an instance." or should begin with the text: "{0}".
Rule.Description: Extends original SA1643 rule (disable SA1643 when using this rule). Allows any destructor to have the following summary text: "Finalizes an instance.".
